results.title: Beta-blockers: a new therapeutic approach to Raynaud's disease.
results.text_hl: In this research we report that chronic beta-blocker treatment, at low dosage, can prevent the cold-induced @<m>DISEASE_Vasospasm_Intracranial</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020301 @@@vasospasm@@@. The majority of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (28) responded to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, and 8 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ refractory to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ responded to @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Brotzu G, Susanna F, Roberto M, Palmina P. Beta-blockers: a new therapeutic approach to Raynaud's disease. Microvasc Res. 1987 Mar;33(2):283-8. PMID: 2884554
